intro: Chlorospatha corrugata, commonly known as the wrinkled leaf fern, is a unique species belonging to the family Polypodiaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, corrugated or ridged fronds that give it its scientific name. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its leaves are usually dark green and have a leathery texture, which helps it retain moisture. The reproductive structures, or sporangia, are clustered on the underside of the fronds, contributing to its propagation in suitable habitats.
